Contributor: Perry, Raymond, artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "Raymond Perry." Date based on date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign.  Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign.  The text tells about James C. Dozier, 1st Lieutenant, Co. G, 118th Infantry, who was a hero in France and received honor for gallantry. He commanded two platoons and though wounded he killed an entire crew of Germans. The text says to "be a Jimmy Dozier" in your bond buying.  The illustration shows two men on the battlefield.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I

Title: America's immortals : James C. Dozier.
